title: 2 Recession-Proof Stocks That Have Recently Beaten Earnings
text: Earnings season is upon us as companies announce financial results for the third quarter of 2022. The high inflation and rising interest rate environment has caused consumer sentiment to slow down, and many companies are missing earnings estimates.

title: Nestle and P&G give heads up on next week's updates from Unilever and Reckitt Benckiser
text: Unilever PLC (LSE:ULVR) and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC (LSE:RKT, ETR:3RB) will both be updating the market with trading updates next week. Results elsewhere today suggest they should be coping with inflationary-ápressures.

title: Procter & Gamble Remains A Buy After Above-Expectations Q1 Earnings
text: Procter & Gamble's Q1 FY 2023 non-GAAP adjusted EPS grew by +29.8% QoQ and beat the analysts' consensus forecast by +1.3%. PG's organic sales growth and profit margins for the first quarter of the current fiscal year also came in above the market's expectations.

title: The Earnings Picture Is Good Enough, So Far
text: The picture emerging from the 2022 Q3 earnings season belies pre-season fears of an impending earnings cliff. The overall corporate profitability picture isn't great, but it isn't bad either.

title: Procter & Gamble (PG) Stock Gains 2% on Earnings Beat
text: A stalwart in the household goods sector, Procter & Gamble (NYSE: PG ) finally demonstrated some of its fundamental resilience when it posted an earnings beat for its fiscal first quarter. The company beat expectations on the top and bottom lines, leading to PG stock gaining 2% in the afternoon session.
